glosses: Derives participle forms of verbs; adjectival and/or resulting state or product of the action.

examples.text: del- (“to drill, to poke a hole”) + -ik → delik (“hole, pierced”)
boz- (“to break, to damage”) + -uk → bozuk (“broken, damaged”)

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish ـیق (-ik) as well as Ottoman Turkish وق (-uk), from Proto-Turkic *-uk, synonymous to Proto-Turkic *-ïg.
